titles.title: International Arbitration Enforcement Act of 1997
To provide for a judicial remedy for United States persons injured as a result of violations by foreign states of their arbitral obligations under international law.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 7/10/1997--Introduced. International Arbitration Enforcement Act of 1997 - Makes liable for money damages any foreign state that has injured a U.S. person through its violation of the Convention on the Recognition and Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Awards with respect to a foreign arbitral award. Amends Federal law to grant district courts exclusive jurisdiction over violations of the Convention. Waives a foreign state's sovereign immunity in any action brought against it for violations of the Convention, including the enforcement of such actions.
